abstract: Saturday Profile on Aboul-Ela Maadi, a Saudi engineer by training who spent nearly 15 years in a quixotic attempt to form the country's Centrist Party; finally successful, Maadi now stands on the brink of a new era in Egyptian politics.
snippet: Aboul-Ela Maadi formed the Center Party in 1996 when he broke with the Muslim Brotherhood, but his ideals are now common among Islamist parties in Egypt and elsewhere.
lead_paragraph: Aboul-Ela Maadi formed the Center Party in 1996 when he broke with the Muslim Brotherhood, but his ideals are now common among Islamist parties in Egypt and elsewhere.

headline.main: A Centrist Pioneer in Egypt Faces New Competition
headline.print_headline: A Centrist Pioneer in Egypt Faces New Competition
headline.seo: Aboul-Ela Maadi, Egypt’s Center Party Leader, Faces New Competition
